intro: Crithmum libanotis, commonly known as the Lebanese parsley or mountain dill, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its aromatic foliage has been historically used in cooking and traditional medicine. Crithmum libanotis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
